title: Getting Started with apa7
text: package provides functions create APA-style tables, including correlation matrices regression tables. functions return flextable objects can processed using flextable package. Although fantastic packages creating tables (e.g., gt, tinytable, kableExtra), flextable package fullest support .docx format, essential anyone working APA style. Almost anything can done .docx table, flextable can handle . Suppose table want format. raw tibble, looks like : use flextable thema_apa function set default, get something close want: Table 1 Model Predictor b beta t df p Model 1 Constant -4.50  -18.46 85.00 0.00 Model 1 Socioeconomic status 1.23 0.24 2.35 85.00 0.02 Model 2 Constant -5.10  -22.46 84.00 0.00 Model 2 Socioeconomic status 1.45 0.31 2.11 84.00 0.03 Model 2 Age -0.23 0.03 0.85 84.00 0.54 Unfortunately, polishing moves can take long time get right. Left align Predictor columns Make Predictor column wider Make negative numbers real minus signs instead hyphens. Decimal align numbers Format p-values Remove leading zeroes beta p Italicize statistic headings * Make row titles number flextable functions can things, applying repeatedly tedious. apa_flextable tries take care issues minimal fuss. Predictor b β t df p Model 1 Constant −4.50  −18.46 85 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.23 .24   2.35 85  .02  Model 2 Constant −5.10  −22.46 84 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.45 .31   2.11 84  .03  Age −0.23 .03   0.85 84  .54  common problem table formatting functions try everything one function make difficult customize output. Like entire flextable ecosystem, apa_flextable function designed flexible terms inputs allows customization afterwards. apa_flextable function returns flextable object can processed flextable functions, needed. example, suppose wanted bold beta coefficient first predictor: Predictor b β t df p Model 1 Constant −4.50  −18.46 85 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.23 .24   2.35 85  .02  Model 2 Constant −5.10  −22.46 84 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.45 .31   2.11 84  .03  Age −0.23 .03   0.85 84  .54  flextable functions take care common formatting problems. can applied specific column names/positions row positions. row positions can selected conditionally based data row. Function Purpose Text bold Bold text color Color text font Font family fontsize Font size highlight Highlight color italic Italicize text Cell align Horizontal alignment bg Background color line_spacing Line spacing padding Cell padding rotate Rotate text surround Cell borders valign Vertical alignment width Column width apa_flextable function formats headers columns headings recognizes. feature can turned : Predictor b beta t df p Model 1 Constant -4.50  -18.46 85 0.00 Socioeconomic status 1.23 0.24 2.35 85 0.02 Model 2 Constant -5.10  -22.46 84 0.00 Socioeconomic status 1.45 0.31 2.11 84 0.03 Age -0.23 0.03 0.85 84 0.54 also possible modify automatic formatting. example, suppose want column called “Predictor” renamed “Variable” make variables upper case (.e., capital letters). column_format function creates object single column. column_formats function creates default list column_format objects. can also set rounding accuracy columns .001 instead default .01. Variable b beta t df p Model 1 CONSTANT −4.500  −18.457 85 <.001 SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS  1.230 0.24   2.345 85  .025 Model 2 CONSTANT −5.100  −22.457 84 <.001 SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS  1.450 0.31   2.114 84  .034 AGE −0.230 0.03   0.854 84  .544 my_formats object list column_format objects. column_format object can specify name, header, formatter, options column. column_formats function creates list column_format objects default settings can modified needed. name header latex AIC *AIC* $AIC$ AICc *AICc* $AICc$ alpha α $\alpha$ b *b* $b$ B *B* $B$ BIC *BIC* $BIC$ BICc *BICc* $BICc$ CFI CFI CFI Chi2 *χ*^2^ $\chi^2$ Chi2_df *df* $df$ CI {round(ci * 100)}% CI {round(ci * 100)}\% CI_high UL UL CI_low LL LL Coefficient *B* $B$ cronbach Cronbach's α Cronbach's $\alpha$ deltaAIC Δ*AIC* $\Delta AIC$ deltaBIC Δ*BIC* $\Delta BIC$ deltachi2 Δχ^2^ $\Delta \chi^2$ deltaR2 Δ*BIC* $\Delta BIC$ df *df* $df$ df_diff Δ*df* $\Delta df$ eta2 *η*^2^ $\eta^2$ Eta2_partial *η*^2^ $\eta^2$ F *F* $F$ m *m* $m$ M *M* $M$ Mean *Mean* $Mean$ n *n* $n$ N *N* $N$ NFI NFI NFI omega ω $\omega$ p *p* $p$ p_Chi2 *p* $p$ Parameter Variable Variable Predictor Variable Variable r *r* $r$ R2 *R*^2^ $R^2$ R2_adjusted adj*R*^2^ $\text{adj}R^2$ RMSE *RMSE* $RMSE$ RMSEA RMSEA RMSEA s *s* $s$ SD *SD* $SD$ SE *SE* $SE$ SE_B *SE_B* $SE~B$ Sigma σ~*e*~ $\sigma_{e}$ Std_Coefficient β $\beta$ t *t* $t$ apa_flextable function performs number formatting operations data data sent flextable. Roughly speaking, apa_flextable, default, performs operations. Apply as_grouped_data restructure row titles, row_title specified. Format data apa_format_columns auto_format_columns = TRUE Separate headers multiple rows separate_headers = TRUE Apply flextable Apply apa_style function (table formatting markdown conversion) apa_style = TRUE Apply pretty_widths pretty_widths = TRUE steps can applied separately. example, want see my_formats data sent flextable, can pre-format data. Data formatting grouping restructuring Data automatic formatting Initial table Predictor Coefficient_*b* Coefficient_β Significant test_*t* Significant test_*df* Significant test_*p* Model 1      Constant −4.50  −18.46 85 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.23 .24   2.35 85  .02  Model 2      Constant −5.10  −22.46 84 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.45 .31   2.11 84  .03  Age −0.23 .03   0.85 84  .54  Table apa styling markdown conversion Predictor Coefficient Significant test b β t df p Model 1      Constant −4.50  −18.46 85 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.23 .24   2.35 85  .02  Model 2      Constant −5.10  −22.46 84 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.45 .31   2.11 84  .03  Age −0.23 .03   0.85 84  .54  Table pretty widths (defaults 6.5in .docx paper width) Predictor Coefficient Significant test b β t df p Model 1      Constant −4.50  −18.46 85 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.23 .24   2.35 85  .02  Model 2      Constant −5.10  −22.46 84 <.001 Socioeconomic status  1.45 .31   2.11 84  .03  Age −0.23 .03   0.85 84  .54
code: library(apa7) library(flextable) library(ftExtra) library(dplyr) library(tibble) set_flextable_defaults(theme_fun = theme_apa,                         font.family = "Times New Roman", text.align = "center") d <- tibble(   Model = paste("Model", c(rep(1,2), rep(2, 3))),   Predictor = c(     "Constant", "Socioeconomic status",      "Constant", "Socioeconomic status", "Age"),   b = c(-4.5, 1.23,          -5.1, 1.45, -.23),   beta = c(NA, .24,             NA, .31, .031),   t = c(-18.457, 2.345,          -22.457, 2.114, .854),   df = c(85,85,           84, 84, 84),   p = c(.0001, .0245,          .0001, .0341, .544))  d #> # A tibble: 5 × 7 #>   Model   Predictor                b   beta       t    df      p #>   <chr>   <chr>                <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 Model 1 Constant             -4.5  NA     -18.5      85 0.0001 #> 2 Model 1 Socioeconomic status  1.23  0.24    2.35     85 0.0245 #> 3 Model 2 Constant             -5.1  NA     -22.5      84 0.0001 #> 4 Model 2 Socioeconomic status  1.45  0.31    2.11     84 0.0341 #> 5 Model 2 Age                  -0.23  0.031   0.854    84 0.544 set_flextable_defaults(   theme_fun = theme_apa,    font.family = "Times New Roman",    text.align = "center")  flextable(d) apa_flextable(d, row_title_column = "Model") apa_flextable(d, row_title_column = "Model") |>    bold(i = 3, j = 3) apa_flextable(d,                row_title_column = "Model",                auto_format_columns = FALSE) column_format(   name = "Predictor",    header = "Variable",   latex = "Variable",   formatter = stringr::str_to_upper) #>  #> ── column_format ── #>  #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   name      header   latex    formatter #>   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>    <list>    #> 1 Predictor Variable Variable <fn> my_formats <- column_formats(accuracy = .001) my_formats$Predictor <- column_format(   name = "Predictor",    header = "Variable",   latex = "Variable",   formatter = stringr::str_to_upper)  my_formats$beta <- NULL  apa_flextable(d,                row_title_column = "Model",                column_formats = my_formats) my_formats@get_tibble |>    select(-formatter) |>   dplyr::arrange(name, .locale = "en") |>    apa_flextable(markdown_body = F) d #> # A tibble: 5 × 7 #>   Model   Predictor                b   beta       t    df      p #>   <chr>   <chr>                <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 Model 1 Constant             -4.5  NA     -18.5      85 0.0001 #> 2 Model 1 Socioeconomic status  1.23  0.24    2.35     85 0.0245 #> 3 Model 2 Constant             -5.1  NA     -22.5      84 0.0001 #> 4 Model 2 Socioeconomic status  1.45  0.31    2.11     84 0.0341 #> 5 Model 2 Age                  -0.23  0.031   0.854    84 0.544 d1 <- flextable::as_grouped_data(d, "Model") |>    mutate(across(c(Model, Predictor), \(x) tidyr::replace_na(x, ""))) |>    tidyr::unite(Predictor, Predictor, Model, sep = "") |>    rename_with(\(x) {     header <- ifelse(x %in% c("b", "beta"), "Coefficient_", "Significant test_")     paste0(header, x)   }, -Predictor) d1 #>              Predictor Coefficient_b Coefficient_beta Significant test_t #> 1              Model 1            NA               NA                 NA #> 2             Constant         -4.50               NA            -18.457 #> 3 Socioeconomic status          1.23            0.240              2.345 #> 4              Model 2            NA               NA                 NA #> 5             Constant         -5.10               NA            -22.457 #> 6 Socioeconomic status          1.45            0.310              2.114 #> 7                  Age         -0.23            0.031              0.854 #>   Significant test_df Significant test_p #> 1                  NA                 NA #> 2                  85             0.0001 #> 3                  85             0.0245 #> 4                  NA                 NA #> 5                  84             0.0001 #> 6                  84             0.0341 #> 7                  84             0.5440 d2 <- apa_format_columns(d1)  d2 #> # A tibble: 7 × 6 #>   Predictor        `Coefficient_*b*` `Coefficient_β` `Significant test_*t*` #>   <chr>            <chr>             <chr>                <chr>                  #> 1 Model 1          ""                ""                   ""                     #> 2 Constant         "−4.50"           ""                   "−18.46"               #> 3 Socioeconomic s… " 1.23"           ".24"                "  2.35"               #> 4 Model 2          ""                ""                   ""                     #> 5 Constant         "−5.10"           ""                   "−22.46"               #> 6 Socioeconomic s… " 1.45"           ".31"                "  2.11"               #> 7 Age              "−0.23"           ".03"                "  0.85"               #> # ℹ 2 more variables: `Significant test_*df*` <chr>, #> #   `Significant test_*p*` <chr> d3 <- flextable::flextable(d2) d3 d4 <- apa_style(d3) |>    align(j = 1, align = "left") |>    padding(j = 1, i = ~(`Coefficient_*b*` != ""), padding.left = 15) |>    surround(i = ~(`Coefficient_*b*` == ""), border.top = flextable::fp_border_default()) d4 pretty_widths(d4)

title: Getting Started with apa7
text: Sometimes want table particular way, package can anticipate exact formatting required. combination tidyverse, apa7, flextable functions, possible get flextable output almost kind APA table need. like unstandardized standardized regression coefficients two models side side. want p-values converted stars appended unstandardized coefficients. Predictor Model 1  Model 2 b β b β Constant −4.50***   −5.10***  Socioeconomic status  1.23*   .24   1.45*   .31 Age    −0.23    .03 Note. b = unstandardized regression coefficient. β = standardized regression coefficient. * p < .05. ** p < .01. *** p < .001
code: d |>    # # decimal align b and append p-value stars   mutate(b = paste0(     align_chr(b),      p2stars(p))) |>    # deselect t, df, and p   select(-c(t,df, p)) |>    # restructure data   tidyr::pivot_wider(     names_from = Model,      values_from = c(b, beta),      names_glue = "{Model}_{.value}",     names_vary = "slowest") |>    # add break column between 2 models   add_break_columns(`Model 1_beta`) |>    # convert to flextable   apa_flextable() |>    # add footnotes   add_footer_lines(     values = as_paragraph_md(       c(paste(         "*Note*. *b* = unstandardized regression coefficient.",         "β = standardized regression coefficient."),         apa_p_star_note()))) |>     # align footnote   align(part = "footer", align = "left") |>    # Make column widths even   width(width = c(2.45,1,1,.05, 1,1))

code: mtcars %>%    proc_freq(row = "gear",              col = "vs")  %>%   theme_apa() mtcars %>%    proc_freq(row = "gear",              col = "vs",             include.row_percent = FALSE,              include.column_percent = FALSE,              include.table_percent = FALSE)  %>%   apa_style(table_width = .5) mytable <- warpbreaks %>%    summarise(     Mean = mean(breaks, na.rm = TRUE),     stdev = sd(breaks, na.rm = TRUE),     sample_size = sum(!is.na(breaks)),     .by = c(wool, tension)   ) %>%   rename(Wool = wool) %>%    mutate(tension = factor(tension, labels = c("Low", "Medium", "High"))) %>%    flextable::tabulator(     x = .,     rows = "Wool",     columns = "tension",     M = as_paragraph(Mean),     SD = as_paragraph(stdev),     n = as_paragraph(sample_size)        ) %>%    flextable::as_flextable()   my_column_names <- mytable$col_keys header_row <- c("", rep("Tension", length(my_column_names) - 1)) %>%    as.list() names(header_row) <- my_column_names  mytable %>%    flextable::theme_apa() %>%    flextable::italic(i = 2, part = "header") %>%    flextable::add_header(values = header_row) %>%    flextable::merge_h(i = 1, "header") %>%    flextable::border(     i = 1,      j = 1,      border.bottom = flextable::fp_border_default(       style = "none",        color = "white"),      part = "header")

title: Correlations
text: styling options include: note custom markdown formatted note. Overrides automatic note bolded correlations significant. Default: NULL p_value Significance value. Default: .05 digits Number digits rounding. Default: 2 bold_significant Whether bold significant correlations. Default: TRUE star_significant Whether star significant correlations. Default: FALSE significance_note Whether note bolding correlations appears. Overridden custom note. Also, automatic note appear correlations significant. Default: TRUE output Options flextable, gt tibble. Default: flextable family Font family (typeface). Default: Times New Roman font_size Font size (points). Default: 12 text_color Text color. Default: black border_color Table border color. Default: black border_width Table border width. Default: 0.5 line_spacing Text line spacing. Default: 2 example, Variable n M SD Skewness Kurtosis 1  2  3  1. Girth 31 13.25  3.14 0.50 −0.71 —      2. Height 31 76.00  6.37 −0.36 −0.72 .52  —    3. Volume 31 30.17 16.44 1.01 0.25 .97 * .60 * —  * p < .001 remove summary statistics entirely, set summary_functions NA NULL.
code: # List of descriptive functions my_summaries <- list(                      n = function(x) sum(!is.na(x)),                      M = mean,                      SD = sd,                      Skewness = psych::skew,                      Kurtosis = psych::kurtosi) trees |>    apa_cor(p_value = .001,            digits = 2,           star_significant = TRUE,            significance_note = TRUE,           summary_functions = my_summaries,           font_family = "Arial",            font_size = 10,            text_color = "darkred",           border_color = "royalblue4",            border_width = 1,            line_spacing = 2) x <- apa_cor(trees,          summary_functions = NA,          bold_significant = FALSE)

code: d <- diamonds %>%    select(cut, price, carat, depth, table) %>%    arrange(cut) %>%    rename_with(str_to_title) %>%    pivot_longer(where(is.numeric), names_to = "Variable") %>%    summarise(     M = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE),     SD = sd(value, na.rm = TRUE),     n = n(),     .by = c(Variable, Cut)) %>%    pivot_longer(c(M, SD)) %>%    unite(Variable, Variable, name) %>%   pivot_wider(names_from = Variable)

title: Add break columns — add_break_columns
text: d data.frame tibble ... unquoted variable names, expression using tidyselect function (contains, start_with, ends_with, matches, num_range, all_of, any_of), character vector variable names .insert break columns selected columns (defaults FALSE) omit_first omit first break column omit_last omit last break column

title: Add break columns — add_break_columns
code: d <- data.frame(x_n = 3, x_mean = 4,             y_n = 5, y_mean = 6,             z_n = 4, z_mean = 4) # Unquoted variable names add_break_columns(d, x_mean) #>   x_n x_mean apa7breakcolumn1 y_n y_mean z_n z_mean #> 1   3      4               NA   5      6   4      4  # Character vector add_break_columns(d, c("y_n", "z_n"),  .before = TRUE) #>   x_n x_mean apa7breakcolumn1 y_n y_mean apa7breakcolumn2 z_n z_mean #> 1   3      4               NA   5      6               NA   4      4  # Tidyselect function (contains, starts_with, ends_with, # matches, num_range, all_of, any_of) # Insert columns after all columns # ending with "_mean" except the last instance add_break_columns(d,                   dplyr::ends_with("_mean"),                   omit_last = TRUE) #>   x_n x_mean apa7breakcolumn1 y_n y_mean apa7breakcolumn2 z_n z_mean #> 1   3      4               NA   5      6               NA   4      4
